meanings.definition: The horizontal angle or direction of a celestial object from the observer, measured clockwise from true north.
meanings.sent1: The azimuth of the sun can help sailors navigate the seas.
meanings.sent2: She pointed her telescope to the correct azimuth to view the stars.
meanings.sent3: The aliens landed their spaceship based on the azimuth of Earth's moon.
meanings.sent4: His passion for astronomy was as clear as the azimuth of the North Star.
meanings.sent5: The azimuth of the comet streaking across the sky left a lasting impression on the stargazers.

meanings.definition: A horizontal angle measured clockwise from a reference direction, usually the northern point of the horizon.
meanings.sent1: The hiker checked the azimuth on his compass before heading into the forest.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor adjusted the azimuth of the theodolite to measure the land accurately.
meanings.sent3: The chef's recipe called for adding ingredients at the azimuth of the kitchen clock.
meanings.sent4: The dancer spun with the grace and precision of an azimuth turning on a compass.
meanings.sent5: The azimuth of the lighthouse beacon guided ships safely to shore during the storm.
